climbs.name: Will All The Real Spray Lords Please Stand Up

content.description:
A tough mantle and and interesting topout make this a very fun problem! Sit start on the lower left rail and make your way to the top! 

  I doubt I'm the FA on this, so if you know the real FA and name of the problem, let me know so I can update the info.
content.location: Directly uphill from the Kingdom Boulder.

content.description: Sit start in the back of the cave, underclinging the crack, then hand jams the rest of the way. Bad landing.
content.location: The right hand crack of the double crack on Injury Wall.

content.description: Fun offwidth requiring some interesting moves to get to the top. Good for the aspiring offwidther!
content.location: Left crack of the double crack on Injury Wall.

content.description: Compression double arete boulder problem. A great problem with tricky beta. An easier (V0-), less fun variation can be done by liebacking the right arete and using the boulder behind it for feet.
content.location: East (behind) and slightly uphill from Injury Wall and the Kingdom boulder.

climbs.name: A Swimming Pool With No Bodies

content.description:
A fun, yet short, overhanging compression boulder problem. A sit start would be possible if the lower rock were more solid.  

  Start with left hand on the lower jug rail and right hand on a sloping openhand low on the right. Exit up and left to a weirdly fun mantle.
content.location: East (behind) and slightly uphill from Injury Wall and the Kingdom boulder. Just to the left of "All Embracing".

content.description: Two large, obvious cracks just uphill from the Kingdom boulder make this area easy to find.
